result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase Allen Vega Kelley

defendant.name: Vega Kelley, Chase Allen
defendant.address: c/o Christina Van Fossen  11333 N Ridge Rd, Edgerton, WI 53534

records.addlTxt: 1:31 PM Defendant Chase Allen Vega Kelley not in court.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Chase Allen Vega Kelley.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on Defendants non appearance-$1000 Cash-reviewable by any court official.

Victim has requested to be present at all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be present at sentencing hearing.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:23 PM Defendant Chase Allen Vega Kelley appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Taylor Klokow appeared by video for Chase Allen Vega Kelley.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Cash bond in the amount of $500 with conditions: Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. No contact directly or indirectly with victim G.P., C.P., S.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Attorney Kelly Freeman to be appointed. Preliminary hearing set for November 4, 2022 at 1:30 PM
No contact directly or indirectly with victim GP, CP and SR, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No driving without valid drivers license or insurance.
